name: People By The Numbers Online Quiz | By The Numbers | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the number of arms (and tentacles) on a squid, and also the number of World Series games won by pitcher Whitey Ford?
questions.explanation:
10.

	Hall of Fame pitcher Whitey Ford played for the New York Yankees. A sick squid is Six English Pounds (Sterling), and to my knowledge no squid has ever played in the World Series.

questions.text: What number is the shoe size of 1930s boxing champion Primo Carnera, and also the number of stories in Chaucer's uncompleted 'Canterbury Tales'?
questions.explanation:
24.

	Chaucer wrote 'Canterbury Tales' circa 1387. He died October 25th 1400, in London , England. Primo Carnera was not known for his literary works.

questions.text: What is the number of letters in the Russian alphabet and also the age of adulthood for hobbits, in the novels of J.R.R. Tolkien?
questions.explanation:
33.

	Tolkien wrote 'The Hobbit' in 1938 and 'The Lord of the Rings' 1954-1956. The Russian alphabet has been used by many prominent people... Kim Philby for one...

questions.text: What is the number of roles played by Frank Morgan in the film 'The Wizard of Oz', and also the number of dice in the game Yahtzee?
questions.explanation:
5.

	Frank Morgan played Professor Marvel, the title character, and a Guard, Cabby and Coachman in the Emerald City. Yahtzee made no appearance in the movie.

questions.text: What is the number of Time magazine covers Richard Nixon has appeared on, and also the number of color squares on a Rubik's Cube?
questions.explanation:
54.

	Nixon was the 37th President of the U.S., and is probably best remembered for the 'Watergate' scandal. The Rubik's cube played no part in the 'Watergate' scandal, but it has been similarly resigned to the pages of history.

questions.text: What is the number of English monarchs buried at London's Westminster Abbey?
questions.explanation:
17.

	Elizabeth I and Charles II are among the monarchs buried in the Abbey. Since George II, British monarchs have been buried at Windsor.

questions.text: What is the number of Academy Award nominations received by Walt Disney during his career, and also the number of squares on a checkerboard and chess board?
questions.explanation:
64.

	Walt Disney's 64 nominations were the most ever for any individual. Checkers was the pet cocker spaniel of Richard Nixon in the 1950s.

questions.text: What is the number of graduates in the first class of the U.S. Military Academy at West Point, and also the number of Volkswagen Beetles sold in the U.S. in 1949?
questions.explanation:
2.

	The first graduating class at West Point was in 1802. Neither of the graduate students drove a Volkswagen Beetle.

questions.text: Number of days in February, usually, and also the number of dominoes in a standard set?
questions.explanation:
28.

	In leap years, there are 29 days.

questions.text: What is the number of words that appear on the penny, dime and quarter denominations of U.S. coins? (not special issues)
questions.explanation:
14.

	The words on the coins are, 'E pluribus unum', 'United States of America', 'In God We Trust' and 'Liberty' and the name of the coin (e.g. 'one dime').  A nickel has 15 words as it also includes "Monticello".
